title: Model Boundaries - Projectile Motion
description: Interactive MicroSim demonstrating that all physics models have boundaries of applicability. Students explore four projectile motion models (naive, no air resistance, linear air resistance, full aerodynamic) and discover where each succeeds or fails based on launch parameters, projectile properties, and atmospheric conditions.
creator: Dan McCreary
subject: Physics
Scientific Modeling
Critical Thinking
learningObjective: Students will be able to analyze the boundaries of applicability for different physics models by testing projectile motion predictions under varying conditions and identifying where models succeed or fail.
learningObjectives: Observe and understand model boundaries - projectile motion in action
Explore how changing parameters affects model boundaries - projectile motion
Apply physics principles to predict model boundaries - projectile motion behavior
Experiment with parameters to observe their effects on model boundaries - projectile motion
